attributes.additional_details: I believe that there is still a stigma attached to epilepsy , epilepsy is very common nowadays  but there is a huge lack of understanding and of we start teaching children about it in schools (primary schools) we can change perception and explain so that people are more aware , in my daughters school they were all made very aware of my daughters severe condition they were able to ask any questions and my daughter is very well looked after by staff and pupils alike I fully believe this is because they were able to understand , ignorance stems from mis understanding which is where prejudice and bullying can come from lets change this perception from the best place , at school x
